name: quicklime production, in pieces, loose | quicklime, in pieces, loose | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10552/documentation

This dataset represents the production of quicklime in Quebec kilns. ;;The only quicklime producer in Quebec provided the following information:;- Diesel, petrol, and electricity consumption, used for solid fuel crushing, pre-heating of kiln, cooling, and on site material transportation.;- A total fossil energy input to the kiln of 4,95MJ/kg of quicklime.;- The amount of biomass (assumed to be ;- Main air emissions (CO2, CO, NOx, particulates, SO2) related to fuel combustion and calcination process. ;;The specific energy mix used by the company for calcination was used to evaluate the other air emissions, based on "heat, district or industrial" processes of the ecoinvent database. ;;However, for confidentiality reasons, the specific energy mix used for calcination by the company is not specified in this dataset. To define fuel inputs, the Quebec industrial heat mix (Ministère du Développement durable, de l'Environnement, de la Faune et des Parcs, MDDEFP, Personal communication) was used instead of the real specific energy mix.  The Quebec industrial heat mix includes:;- 8.3% Coal;- 3.4% Coke;- 1.4% Petroleum coke;- 58.4% Natural gas;- 1.4% Light fuel oil;- 26.8% Heavy fuel oil;- 0.3% Propane;;Infrastructure data was extrapolated from "quicklime production, in pieces, loose, GLO 2000-2002" ecoinvent dataset : The value of the infrastructure is normalized with a annual production capacity of about 75'000tons of product per year. The estimated lifespan of the machines is 25 years. ;;This activity describes a pre-product for the milling process, and therefore for module "quicklime, milled, loose, at plant".

From reception of raw materials, at the plant site.

This activity ends with the quicklime at kiln gate.
 
The dataset includes the calcination process. Also included is the electricity consumption for pre-heating the fuels, crushing and milling of solid fuels, and used in scrubber, cooler and dust collector. Part of the total heating energy for "production" and "administration" is also included. Equipment included in the infrastructure: 2 vertical kilns (extrapolated from GLO dataset. See Technology for details).
The dataset doesn't include the use of fireproof bricks since no data are available. Only the measured emissions are included.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Quebec data are from the only company that produces quicklime on the territory. Unavalable data were extrapolated based on the GLO dataset exchanges. Uncertainties adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The Quebec limestone producer operates five(5) kilns, including four (4) rotative kiln with pre-heaters, and one (1) vertical MAERZ kiln. In the current dataset, infrastructures for vertical kilns is included (extrapolated from "quicklime production, in pieces, loose, GLO 2000-2002" ecoinvent dataset. No infrastructure information were collected from Quebec producer.; Fuel used for the calcination process varies from one kiln to another, and includes natural gas, coal, coke, heavy fuel oil, light fuel oil and biomass.;For confidentiality reasons, the specific energy mix used by the company is not specified in this dataset. The Quebec industrial heat mix was used instead (see general comments for details).;;Values in this dataset represents a weighted average of all kilns, based on their annual production.;Dust collector in use to reduce particulate emissions.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
A weighted average of the three quicklime production plants in Quebec was used.
When no information available, GLO exchanges have been used as proxy for Quebec. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
 
See Geography and Technolgy fields for details.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Information provided by the only Quebec producer
